definitions.definition: the man that somebody is married to; a married man

examples.text: She's finally decided to **leave her husband**.
She **lost her husband** *(= he died)* recently.
It had been a shock to find himself a **husband and father**.
She lost her husband to cancer a year ago.
She suddenly walked out on her husband, leaving him to bring up the children.
That was the day she met her future husband.

definitions.definition: a man and woman who are married to each other

examples.text: They lived together as husband and wife *(= as if they were married)* for years.

wordOrigin: late Old English in the senses ‘male head of a household’ and ‘manager, steward’, from Old Norse húsomebodyóndi ‘master of a house’, from hús ‘house’ + bóndi ‘occupier and tiller of the soil’. The original sense of the verb was ‘till, cultivate’.
